intro: Unona lessertiana, commonly known as the lesser unona, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Unona lessertiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils.
